basic Package¶

sessionModel Module¶

fla.gr session model

Basically what we have is a key value store in redis of all the session ID’s (store and retrieved via the cookie from Seshat)

http://xkcd.com/353/

Josh Ashby 2013 http://joshashby.com joshuaashby@joshashby.com

class models.basic.sessionModel.dummySession(cookieID)¶

Bases: object

Dummy object which is made when no session could be found in redis Supports all the methods and attributes which are needed for fla.gr to run smoothly in anonymous mode. Other attributes are provided so the session can also be subclassed (provided the dummy session in the above method session is updated to use the subclassed dummy) for testing.

clearAlerts()¶

Clears the alerts for the current session. Only if the alert is set to expire next however, will it be cleared, allowing for persistent alerts.

getAlerts()¶

Returns a str on compiled alerts, for direct placement in a template

Returns:Str of alerts
logout()¶

Dummy interface. Not sure if this is needed, so it may soon be removed

pushAlert(message, quip='', alertType='info', expire='next')¶

Creates an alert message to be displayed or relayed to the user, This is a higher level one for use in HTML templates. All params are of type str

Parameters:
  • message – The text to be placed into the main body of the alert
  • quip – Similar to a title, however just a quick attention getter
  • alertType – Can be any of success error info warning
  • expire – Currently this isn’t used, however it can be set to anything other than next to have the alert stay permanently
save()¶

Same as store Simply stores the sessions alerts in redis for the next page load from the session.

saveAlerts()¶

Saves the current users alerts and places them into redis

store(dbDummy)¶

Dummy interface to make this behave like a couchdb-python document, so common interfaces can be “used”

Not sure if this is used anywhere so I may end up removing it in a refactor sometime soon.

models.basic.sessionModel.session(cookieID)¶

Attempt to make a user to the current session, returning the userORM if one is found.

Parameters:cookieID – The session id, taken from the browsers cookie data.
Returns:Either a userORM object, if a user is found associated with a session, otherwise, a dummySession anonymous object.
